description: Access is the database application within the Microsoft Office suite.  Many businesses, large and small, use Access to store large amounts of information. Just like building a strong house, you must have a solid foundation. We start from the very beginning discussing how to plan a database, introducing basic terminology and key concepts of relational database design, and exploring the Access Interface. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports.  This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials.  Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.

We start from the very beginning discussing how to plan a database, introducing basic terminology and key concepts of relational database design, and exploring the Access Interface. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports.  This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials.  Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.
name: Access 2016 Essentials
subtitle: Database application

episodes.description: Access is the database application within the Microsoft Office suite. Many businesses, large and small, use Access to store large amounts of information. Just like building a strong house, you must have a solid foundation. We start from the very beginning discussing how to plan a database, introducing basic terminology and key concepts of relational database design, and exploring the Access Interface. Then we dive more in depth into each object in an Access databases - tables, queries, forms, and reports. This series is targeted for users who want to get started in Access or users that want a refresher on Access essentials. Access is a Windows only product and only available as a local installation.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:08.832
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:08.832 --> 00:00:14.512
Hello and welcome to OfficeProTV.

3
00:00:14.512 --> 00:00:16.745
I'm your host, Vonne Smith, and

4
00:00:16.745 --> 00:00:20.518
this is the Access 2016
Essentials Course overview.

5
00:00:20.518 --> 00:00:24.469
And in this episode we're going to be
reviewing well exactly what is this

6
00:00:24.469 --> 00:00:26.400
show going to be covering.

7
00:00:26.400 --> 00:00:28.270
Who is this show for?

8
00:00:28.270 --> 00:00:30.460
Do I need to know anything
before I get started?

9
00:00:30.460 --> 00:00:33.970
And any extra tit bits along the way.

10
00:00:33.970 --> 00:00:38.573
So let's talk about topics that we are
going to be covering this is an essential

11
00:00:38.573 --> 00:00:43.038
show, we started at very beginning of
introducing different topics within

12
00:00:43.038 --> 00:00:45.082
Access, like what is a database?

13
00:00:45.082 --> 00:00:47.470
What does it mean to have a select query?

14
00:00:47.470 --> 00:00:50.166
How do I get around
the interface of Access?

15
00:00:50.166 --> 00:00:53.854
Well, that's all covered in
this introduction topic, or

16
00:00:53.854 --> 00:00:56.004
section of this particular show.

17
00:00:56.004 --> 00:00:59.348
Then we're gonna go ahead and
get into creating tables,

18
00:00:59.348 --> 00:01:03.758
where all of your data is actually
stored within your Access database.

19
00:01:03.758 --> 00:01:07.701
So we're gonna learn how to create tables,
how to import information,

20
00:01:07.701 --> 00:01:09.910
whether from an Excel file or a CSV file.

21
00:01:09.910 --> 00:01:14.330
And we're also gonna be talking about
the relationships that we have between

22
00:01:14.330 --> 00:01:15.080
our tables.

23
00:01:15.080 --> 00:01:19.800
Very important key concepts
about designing a database.

24
00:01:19.800 --> 00:01:23.857
Then we're gonna move into creating
queries or questions that we're

25
00:01:23.857 --> 00:01:27.992
going to be asking of our data,
to be able to pull out that information.

26
00:01:27.992 --> 00:01:32.507
And within this particular topic,
we're also gonna talk about some of

27
00:01:32.507 --> 00:01:37.323
the flaws that we have encountered or
created, some little mistakes that we

28
00:01:37.323 --> 00:01:41.784
made in our database as we were
designing this out and working with it.

29
00:01:41.784 --> 00:01:45.469
And be able to show you guys some
of the mistakes we've made so

30
00:01:45.469 --> 00:01:49.590
you can learn from our mistakes,
and be able to really solidify that

31
00:01:49.590 --> 00:01:53.650
foundational knowledge of
proper database design.

32
00:01:53.650 --> 00:01:57.225
Then we move into making forms,
this is where we could go ahead and

33
00:01:57.225 --> 00:02:01.710
input the information into our database,
into our tables, how to create forms.

34
00:02:01.710 --> 00:02:04.502
Where we'll talk about controls and
fields and

35
00:02:04.502 --> 00:02:07.025
how that maps out to our different tables.

36
00:02:07.025 --> 00:02:10.347
And then we'll get into reporting
the data, generating reports,

37
00:02:10.347 --> 00:02:13.493
because everybody knows that they
have that one boss that says,

38
00:02:13.493 --> 00:02:17.350
can you go ahead and give me that
report by Friday, that would be great.

39
00:02:17.350 --> 00:02:20.595
So we're gonna go ahead and
show you how to do that.

40
00:02:20.595 --> 00:02:26.051
Now this particular show is designated for
a beginner user in Access,

41
00:02:26.051 --> 00:02:30.674
or maybe you have no prior
knowledge of Access at any level,

42
00:02:30.674 --> 00:02:33.340
then this is the show for you.

43
00:02:33.340 --> 00:02:39.170
And I say all Officer users with
a capital O, meaning the Office Suite.

44
00:02:39.170 --> 00:02:43.530
Not necessarily that you work in an office
or not, like a physical location, but

45
00:02:43.530 --> 00:02:46.430

46
00:02:46.430 --> 00:02:51.258
Now a little caveat on this
particular product here is that,

47
00:02:51.258 --> 00:02:54.010
Access is a Windows only product.

48
00:02:54.010 --> 00:02:59.120
They do not make Office or Access for
Mac, so you will have to do that.

49
00:02:59.120 --> 00:03:01.879
So if you're on a Mac,
you might wanna go look

50
00:03:01.879 --> 00:03:05.946
at something else on different shows
on how you might wanna use it,

51
00:03:05.946 --> 00:03:09.744
cuz there is no equivalent there

52
00:03:09.744 --> 00:03:11.468
Now the prerequisites like I just said,

53
00:03:11.468 --> 00:03:13.809
you don't have to have any
prior knowledge of Access.

54

If you have some familiarity we say Excel.

55

You're looking to maybe kinda go from
Excel to Access then we would have

56

57

And I actually use a lot of
correlations between this product and

58

59
00:03:32.790 --> 00:03:35.718
And then Ronnie, who's going to be

60

62

But also having a basic understanding of

64

Extra information,
there's always other options.

65

you could also probably double click

67
00:03:57.100 --> 00:04:01.750
there's multiple ways to get to the same

68

So just keep that in mind, and you might

70

So there's always different options,
and we might not cover them all,

71

Updates happen,
yes this is a subscription based product,

Of course, you could have a single,

75

But if you are on that Office 365

76

And by the time that you're watching this

78

There might be a few things that

79

Searching for answers, yep there's

118

You don't really don't have to worry

120
00:07:07.210 --> 00:07:12.720
But take the name of the episode, and then

00:07:12.720 --> 00:07:17.820
So you can see that
the Database Terminology pt 2 is

122

123

00:07:27.210 --> 00:07:31.427
And as you can see, this kinda goes

125

126

along the way.

127
00:07:40.180 --> 00:07:43.652
There are a few little things I wanted
to point out that we do have some kinda

128
00:07:43.652 --> 00:07:46.160

129
00:07:46.160 --> 00:07:51.190
Because this is a show that we intend
to have you watch as a sequence.

130
00:07:51.190 --> 00:07:56.290
So it goes from show one all the way down,
or episode one down through.

131
00:07:56.290 --> 00:08:00.320
If you're picking up on one

132
00:08:00.320 --> 00:08:02.100

133
00:08:02.100 --> 00:08:07.750
Just take notice that some of the episodes

So somethings that might be

135

00:08:17.360 --> 00:08:18.685
So we do kind of use this,

00:08:18.685 --> 00:08:22.361

138
00:08:22.361 --> 00:08:28.937
So they are meant to be washed within

139
00:08:28.937 --> 00:08:33.057
Do notice that some of the file names
might be a little different from one

140
00:08:33.057 --> 00:08:33.890

141
00:08:33.890 --> 00:08:38.430
For example, I have some ones

142
00:08:38.430 --> 00:08:41.470
here in the external data

143
00:08:41.470 --> 00:08:43.310
Cuz I created that after the episode, so

you would have a file
to follow up on with.

145
00:08:45.214 --> 00:08:51.230
But the file name in the episode,
might not match that, and that's okay.

146
00:08:51.230 --> 00:08:54.890
And so you can see that we have to this
point, this is where the file ends,

147
00:08:54.890 --> 00:08:56.270

00:08:56.270 --> 00:08:58.790
And then we have kind

00:08:58.790 --> 00:09:02.990
up to this point that's where this

150
00:09:02.990 --> 00:09:06.090
So, just consult this particular
guide to go ahead and

151
00:09:06.090 --> 00:09:11.230
match up the different exercise
files to the episodes.

152
00:09:11.230 --> 00:09:16.143
And then just as little note down here
that I have for you guys is that,

153
00:09:16.143 --> 00:09:20.650
we did try very hard to make sure
that the files do match, okay?

154
00:09:20.650 --> 00:09:24.745
But, and sometimes there might have
like a couple extra things in there so

00:09:24.745 --> 00:09:28.048
you could see there has extra
different objects compared to

156
00:09:28.048 --> 00:09:31.570
the episode files in the recordings,
and they should be fine.

157
00:09:31.570 --> 00:09:35.747
You could see that between filming
episodes, we do modify our files here and

158
00:09:35.747 --> 00:09:38.370
there to make sure that
everything is working.

159
00:09:38.370 --> 00:09:43.157
And then we readjust them to be able
to have you guys have a starting

160
00:09:43.157 --> 00:09:45.520
point of where to follow along.

161
00:09:45.520 --> 00:09:49.389
But just keep in mind that
the findings might be different and,

162
00:09:49.389 --> 00:09:53.185
some of the episodes like I said
before they do work off each and

163
00:09:53.185 --> 00:09:55.457
I do try to notate in those episodes.

164
00:09:55.457 --> 00:10:00.512
For example right here in our reports
that, the reports part four is

165
00:10:00.512 --> 00:10:05.790
continuing the same example that
we started in the part three file.

166
00:10:05.790 --> 00:10:09.525
So, just wanted to make a note of that and
so you all are very aware of that.

167
00:10:09.525 --> 00:10:13.279
I've made this guide for you guys so
go ahead and download those episodes.

168
00:10:13.279 --> 00:10:17.142
But that goes ahead and
wraps up my overview of the course, and

169
00:10:17.142 --> 00:10:19.460
the overview of the exercise files.

170
00:10:19.460 --> 00:10:23.085
So I hope to see you very soon,
and let's have some fun in Access.

171
00:10:23.085 --> 00:10:29.559
[MUSIC].

episodes.description: The dynamic dou of Vonne and Ronnie are back together to bring you Access 2016. In this episode, they review the basic question of what is Access, where it belongs in the Office suite, and other introductory topics.
episodes.title: Introduction to Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the concept of a database with a great analogy - laundry! They discuss the importance of organizing data and how the data relates to one another. They also discuss how Excel and Access differ in how they interact with data. They then take a trip down memory lane with examples of analog databases.
episodes.title: What is a Database

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne define and explain key terms in general databases and Access.
episodes.title: Database Terminology

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne had so much fun defining terms, they had to make a part 2! They continue to explain key terms in general databases and Access.
episodes.title: Database Terminology Part 2

episodes.description: Don't know where to begin in building a database in Access? Luckily, Access has templates to get you going.  Ronnie and Vonne explore creating a template database and indentify what Acccess creates for us.
episodes.title: Getting Started in Access

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie explore the Access interface. They identify the title bar, quick access toolbar, ribbon, status bar, and navigation pane.
episodes.title: Access Interface and Navigation

episodes.description: Prior proper planning prevents poor performance. Vonne and Ronnie talk about the importance of planning out a database and review basic concepts of relational database design.
episodes.title: Planning and Database Design

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie continue their discussion about planning a database.  Specifically, they review how they determined the fields needed in their tables for the show's database. They also touch upon the concept of data normalization.
episodes.title: Planning and Database Design Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie create their first table in a new database. They create fields and determine data types in the design view. They also review the field properties. Lastly, they enter in records in the datasheet view.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Manual Data Entry

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie continue to create tables in Access 2016.  They discuss the reason to import data and show how Access tools can help us quickly build our tables to get them ready for use.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Importing External Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie continue to create tables in Access 2016.  They discuss the reason to import data and show how Access tools can help us quickly build our tables to get them ready for use.
episodes.title: Creating Tables: Importing External Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie help you to understand relationships between tables.  They discuss the most common types of table relationships. Using Access, they show how to make those relationships work.
episodes.title: Creating Table Relationships

episodes.description: After reviewing the concepts of relationships in the previous episode, Vonne and Ronnie are back to demonstrate how to create table relationships in Access.
episodes.title: Creating Table Relationships Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie introduce queries in Access. They review the different types of queries available and run a simple select query through the query wizard.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Desgin

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more on queries. In this episode, they create queries in the design view and even show how to write a very simple SQL query.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne share some of the issues they discovered in their database from running queries. In this episode, they show problems with mismatched entered data as well as mismatched data types.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 3

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne continue to share some of the issues they discovered in their database from running queries. In this episode, they reveal issues with the relationships between tables and demonstrate how to fix them.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 4

episodes.description: In the final episode of the query mini-series, Vonne and Ronnie discuss some of the final issues they discovered in their database design.  They reestablish some more table relationships and add fields to correct some logic issues with the data.
episodes.title: Creating Queries for Testing Design Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie discuss the importance of forms in Access. They show how to create a form using the form button and introduce the concept of a subform. They end the episode with a brief introduction to the form wizard.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more on forms in Access. They continue with the form wizard, demonstrating the different layouts that are available. They also create a basic form from the blank form button.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie create a form in design view. They demonstrate how to add label controls and how to manipulate their placement in the form.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 3

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie wrap up the Access forms miniseries by demonstrating some key layout and design formatting.  They show how to align and distribute form elements, explore the layout view, and add a combo box control.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Forms Part 4

episodes.description: Ronnie and Vonne introduce us to reports in Access. They discuss the importance of good reports to summarize and display the information in your database.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie show how to create reports. They create mailing labels, use the report button, start from a blank report, and walk through the report wizard. They also show how to modify report layouts in the layout view.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie are back with more reports in Access. In this episode, they explore creating a report in the design view (banded report writer). They explain the different sections of the banded report writer and how to summarize data with the group and sort command.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne dive deeper into building reports in design view. They demonstrate what happens when you add a field into a report that does not have a relationship established to the current report.  They show how to create a calculated field with expression builder as well as summarize data in the section footer. Finally, they begin to build a query as an alternative way to create a report.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 4

episodes.description: In this final episode, Ronnie and Vonne create a report from a table created from a query. They show us how to create a concatenated field in the query to ultimately create a section header in the report. They also review how to align and format fields as well as change background colors of the different sections.
episodes.title: Creating Basic Reports Part 5
